newsitem.title: CANADA: Eaton trade creditors pleased with payment plan.
newsitem.headline: Eaton trade creditors pleased with payment plan.

text.p: The committee representing trade creditors of embattled T. Eaton Co said on Friday its members will receive C$0.50 on the dollar in cash and the remainder in interest bearing notes under the department store retailer's restructuring plan.
"The fact that Eaton's will survive and continue to be a good customer is very important to the trade creditors," committee spokesman Melvin Zwaig said in a statement.
Zwaig said his group has not seen the restructuring proposal yet, but had obtained details of the payment plan for trade creditors.
The retailer planned to file the restructuring plan in an Ontario court late this afternoon.
The family-owned company filed for bankruptcy protection on February 27 and owes about C$400 million to banks and creditors such as U.S. vulture brokerages.
